thread.title: Dixie Chicks, Ryan Adams headed for Bridge School concerts
thread.title_full: Dixie Chicks, Ryan Adams headed for Bridge School concerts - San Francisco Chronicle

author: Aidin Vaziri
title: Dixie Chicks, Ryan Adams headed for Bridge School concerts
text:
Photo: Barry Brecheisen, Associated Press In the 2012 Bridge School benefit, Pegi Young and Neil Young take the stage at Shoreline Amphitheatre. In the 2012 Bridge School benefit, Pegi Young and Neil Young take...
Dixie Chicks, Sheryl Crow, Ben Harper, Ryan Adams and the indie-rock band Spoon are set to go acoustic for the annual Bridge School Benefit Concert, taking place at Shoreline Amphitheatre in Mountain View on Saturday and Sunday, Oct. 24 and 25. Breaking from the apparent 2002 theme of this year’s lineup will be relative newcomers St. Vincent and Gary Clark Jr., who will join the above acts, as well as headliner and host Neil Young and his band Promise of the Real. Proceeds go to the school Neil and ex-wife Pegi Young founded in 1986 to help children with severe speech and physical impairments. Dixie Chicks, Sheryl Crow, Ben Harper, Ryan Adams and the indie-rock band Spoon are set to go acoustic for the annual Bridge School Benefit Concert, taking place at Shoreline Amphitheatre in Mountain View on Saturday and Sunday, Oct. 24 and 25. Breaking from the apparent 2002 theme of this year’s lineup will be relative newcomers St. Vincent and Gary Clark Jr., who will join the above acts, as well as headliner and host Neil Young and his band Promise of the Real. Proceeds go to the school Neil and ex-wife Pegi Young founded in 1986 to help children with severe speech and physical impairments.
